medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr E noticed thinning of his hands about 20 years ago and has experienced increasing difficulty with hand function over the past 10 years, including trouble opening jars and claw deformities of his last two fingers. He began noticing memory loss in the past 10 years, with increasing trouble remembering names and word-finding difficulties. He attributes the increase in alcohol consumption to retirement and feeling 'down in the dumps.'
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, which has been difficult to manage; history of three herniorrhaphies; previously borderline low vitamin B12 levels treated with injections; a slow progressive sensorimotor polyneuropathy, likely hereditary, diagnosed as a Charcot-Marie-Tooth variant.
medical_history.social_history: Mr E is a retired attorney who enjoys drinking alcoholic beverages, with a history of heavy drinking (up to 3 to 4 vodkas daily). He is single and has been separated from his family, exercises regularly, does not smoke, and has experienced increased alcohol consumption following retirement.
